unnormalised: **Yoga Practices: Beyond the Asanas, what works for me?**
normalised: **Yoga Practices: Beyond the Asanas, what works for me?**

unnormalised: Okay, folks, let's talk Yoga! We see all these picture-perfect poses on Instagram, right? But honestly, yoga is so much more than just holding Vrksasana perfectly. It's a whole lifestyle, and what works for one person in Bangalore might not work for another in Delhi.
normalised: Okay, folks, let's talk Yoga! We see all these picture-perfect poses on Instagram, right? But honestly, yoga is so much more than just holding Vrksasana perfectly. It's a whole lifestyle, and what works for one person in Bangalore might not work for another in Delhi.

unnormalised: For me, it started with Surya Namaskar every morning. It's classic, I know, but it really helps wake up my body and sets a positive tone for the day. Then I try to squeeze in a 30-minute session focusing on Pranayama – breathing exercises. Anulom Vilom is my go-to for calming my mind. Seriously, try it!
normalised: For me, it started with Surya Namaskar every morning. It's classic, I know, but it really helps wake up my body and sets a positive tone for the day. Then I try to squeeze in a thirty minute session focusing on Pranayama – breathing exercises. Anulom Vilom is my go-to for calming my mind. Seriously, try it!

unnormalised: I also find that incorporating yogic principles into daily life makes a huge difference. Things like Ahimsa (non-violence) help me approach situations with more compassion and patience. It's not always easy, especially during peak traffic hours on Hosur Road, but I try!
normalised: I also find that incorporating yogic principles into daily life makes a huge difference. Things like Ahimsa (non-violence) help me approach situations with more compassion and patience. It's not always easy, especially during peak traffic hours on Hosur Road, but I try!

unnormalised: I go to a yoga class at a local studio near my home, it is ~ 5 km far from my home, three times a week. The teacher, Dr. Sharma, is amazing and really emphasizes alignment and mindful movement. The studio is ~500 sq ft and always crowded but vibes are good.

The teacher, Doctor Sharma, is amazing and really emphasizes alignment and mindful movement. The studio is approximately five hundred square feet and always crowded but vibes are good.

unnormalised: Anyone else have specific yoga practices or experiences they'd like to share? What are your favorite asanas? Do you follow any specific styles (Ashtanga, Hatha, etc.)? I'm curious to hear your thoughts! Maybe we can all learn from each other and build a healthier lifestyle. My budget for classes is Rs. 2000 per month! Namaste.
